standards.header: Qualified radiologist is responsible for managing the radiology department.

details.header: The head of the radiology department is a radiologist qualified by education, training, and experience.
The head of the radiology department supervises the development and implementation of policies and procedures related to radiology services throughout the hospital.

standards.header: The radiology department has adequate qualified staff.

details.header: The radiology department has adequate staff, including:
details: Radiation safety officer and supervisor (for radiotherapy nuclear medicine and diagnostics).

details.header: Staff working in the department are trained and qualified in their field.
There is twenty four hour coverage by a radiologist and a technologist.

standards.header: The radiology department has policies and procedures that guide all radiological activities.

details.header: The radiology department has policies and procedures to address all important radiological investigations and procedures, including:

standards.header: Requests for radiological investigations utilize a standardized method throughout the hospital.

details.header: There is a special request form utilized by the medical staff for all requests related to radiology department.
Relevant information, including a brief case description and rationale for the investigation, are documented on the radiology request form for all diagnostic and/or interventional imaging procedures.

standards.header: The radiology department implements a policy and procedure that defines the process and time limits of results reporting for all radiological studies.

details.header: The radiology department defines and implements the format and content of radiology reports (paper or electronic). Essential elements of the report include:
The radiological studies are reported by the radiologist within defined time limits.
details: Urgent cases are reported within twenty four hours.
Routine cases are reported within forty eight hours.

standards.header: The radiology department implements a policy and procedure for reporting of critical results.

details.header: There is a policy and procedure for reporting of critical results developed in consultation with clinical departments.
The policy defines the notified party and mean of communication.
The policy defines the “read- back“ sequence of reporting of critical results.
The policy defines the proper documentation of a notification event, which includes:

standards.header: Previous radiological studies can always be accessed.

details.header: There is a master X-ray jacket or an access to all archived previous radiological studies (Picture Archiving and Communication System-PACS) for every patient.

standards.header: The radiology department has a documented and implemented safety plan.

details.header: There is a safety plan that indicates the periodic inspection, maintenance, and calibration of all equipment.
The safety plan involves the management of radioactive materials used for therapeutic and diagnostic purposes, particularly with regard to handling, storing, and transportation.
The safety plan involves posting of safety warnings on the doors.
The safety plan involves checking female patients for pregnancy before exposure.
The safety plan indicates monitoring of the staff for radiation exposure, at least quarterly.
The safety plan involves the provision and regular testing of radiation protection aprons and thyroid and gonad shields for staff and patients.
Records are available indicating the radiation dosimetry tools and staff radiation exposure for the past twelve months.
The safety plan is implemented as evidenced by the daily practice.

standards.header: The radiology department has a documented and implemented protocol for interventional radiological procedures.

details.header: There is a documented protocol for interventional radiological procedures, which indicates pre- procedural assessments (patient and procedure verification, rationale for the procedure, past history and history of allergic reactions, coagulation profile, informed consent with explanation of risks and benefits).
The protocol indicates monitoring requirements during and after the procedure.
Findings of patient assessment and monitoring are documented in the patient’s medical record.

standards.header: The radiology department ensures the safety of diagnostic imaging equipment.

details.header: The radiology department ensures the following tests are conducted at least annually:
details: Alignment of collimator and x-ray field.

details.header: The radiology department implements corrective actions accordingly.
